H0.text: A ribosome transports the newly synthesized protein from the site of synthesis to the site of modification by the addition of a carbohydrate.

H1.text: The endoplasmic reticulum transports a newly synthesized protein from its site of synthesis to the site where the protein is modified by addition of a carbohydrate.

H2.text: The Golgi apparatus transports the newly synthesized protein from its site of synthesis to the site of modification where it receives a carbohydrate addition.

H3.text: A vacuole transports a newly synthesized protein from the site of synthesis to the site of carbohydrate modification in a cell.

A4.text: Proteins synthesized in the ER are packaged into vesicles, which then fuse with the Golgi apparatus.

A5.text: The Golgi apparatus is a major collection and dispatch station of protein products received from the endoplasmic reticulum.
